propertyGroup.name: Outlet Properties
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: services
property.documentation: The location to which all service classes (including the service locator(s)) will be generated.

property.name: entity-beans
property.documentation: The directory to which Entity POJOs are generated.

property.name: entity-impls
property.documentation: The location to which Entity POJO implementation files are generated.

property.name: entity-config
property.documentation: The location where the persistence XML descriptor is generated.

property.name: session-beans
property.documentation: The directory to which Session Bean files are generated.

property.name: session-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which Session Bean implementation files are generated.

property.name: session-config
property.documentation: The location where the ejb-jar.xml XML descriptor is generated.

property.name: message-driven-beans
property.documentation: The directory to which Message Driven Bean files are generated.

property.name: message-driven-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which Message Driven Bean implementation files are generated.

property.name: commons
property.documentation: The directory to which common classes for session beans, entity POJOs or MDB are generated

property.name: entityManagerName
property.documentation: The name assigned to the entity manager. If no name is specified, the name of the containing persistence archive without the .par extension is used.

property.name: entityManagerJTADataSource
property.documentation: Specifies the global JNDI name of the JTA data source.

property.name: hibernateHbm2DDLAuto
property.documentation:
Automatically export schema DDL to the database when deployed. With create-drop, the database schema will be dropped when the entity is undeployed. Permitted values are:
update
create
create-drop
none

property.name: hibernateDialect
property.documentation:
The SQL dialect of the database.
org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLInnoDBDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.MySQLMyISAMDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.HSQLDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.DB2Dialect
org.hibernate.dialect.OracleDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.Oracle9Dialect
org.hibernate.dialect.SybaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.SQLServerDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.SAPDBDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.InformixDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.IngresDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.ProgressDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.InterbaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.PointbaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.FrontbaseDialect
org.hibernate.dialect.FirebirdDialect

property.name: hibernateShowSql
property.documentation: Whether or not to log SQL statements.

property.name: hibernateMaxFetchDepth
property.documentation: Sets a maximum "depth" for the outer join fetch tree. Recommended values between 0 and 3

property.name: hibernateJdbcFetchSize
property.documentation: A non-zero value determines the JDBC fetch size

property.name: hibernateJdbcBatchSize
property.documentation: A nonzero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. Recommended values between 5 and 30

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseScrollableResultSet
property.documentation: Whether or not to enable use of JDBC2 scrollable resultsets by Hibernate. This property is only necessary when using user supplied connections. Hibernate uses connection metadata otherwise.

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseStreamsForBinary
property.documentation: Whether or not to use streams when writing / reading binary or serializable types to/from JDBC.

property.name: hibernateCacheProvider
property.documentation:
Defines Hibernate Cache Provider implementation class. Possible values for JBoss4/Hibernate are:
org.hibernate.cache.HashtableCacheProvider
org.jboss.ejb3.entity.TreeCacheProviderHook

property.name: hibernateTreecacheMbeanObject
property.documentation:
Defines the Hibernate cache MBean object name used in JBoss4.
jboss.cache:service=EJB3EntityTreeCache

property.name: hibernateTransactionFlushBeforeCompletion
property.documentation:
Define if the session will automatically be flushed during the before completion phase of the transaction. Handy options for CMT demarcation. Possible values are:
true
false

property.name: hibernateTransactionAutoCloseSession
property.documentation:
Define if the session will be automatically closed during the after completion phase of the transaction. Handy option when using CMT demarcation. Possible values are:
true
false

property.name: entityNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Entity all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Entity".

property.name: entityImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the entity implementation name.

property.name: entityListenerNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity listener class name.

property.name: entityEmbeddableNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity embeddable super class name.

property.name: serviceNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing a service bean name. {0} is used to represent the service bean name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Bean all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Bean".

property.name: serviceLocalInterfaceNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean local interface name.

property.name: serviceRemoteInterfaceName
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean remote interface name.

property.name: serviceImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean implementation name.

property.name: serviceListenerNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean listener class name.

property.name: serviceDelegateNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the service bean delegate class name.

property.name: serviceImplementationOperationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to the create the implementation operation name (i.e. the operations that actually perform the handling of the logic), where {0} represents the operation name.

property.name: defaultServiceExceptionNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the default service exception name. NOTE: This propety is only applicable when allowDefaultServiceExceptions is true.

property.name: messageDrivenNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when construction the JMS message driven bean class name.

property.name: messageDrivenListenerNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constucting the JMS message driven bean listener class name.

property.name: messageDrivenImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the JMS message driven bean implementation class name.

property.name: interceptorNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the interceptor class name.

property.name: entityCompositePrimaryKeyNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the composite primary key class name.

property.name: jndiNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix to give to the EJB JNDI names (this allows the same EJBs to be deployed multiple times in the same container)

property.name: messageDrivenDestinationType
property.documentation:
The default destination type for a JMS message driven bean. Possible values are:
javax.jms.Queue
javax.jms.Topic

property.name: entityViewType
property.documentation:
The default view type accessability for an entity POJO bean.
Permitted values are:
local
remote
both

property.name: entityDefaultCascade
property.documentation:
The value of the CascadeType annotation of the entity association. Possible values are:
ALL
PERSIST
MERGE
REMOVE
REFRESH
NONE if one does not exist

property.name: entityCompositeCascade
property.documentation:
Indicates how a UML composition should be interpreted to determine cascadable operations that are propogated to the associated entity.
If undefined, the cascade attribute is computed by AndroMDA. If default cascade is all , then cascade is all otherwise cascade is REMOVE .
If ths property is defined, its value is generated at each occurence of a UML composition as the inverse side is not marked with a cascade annotation element which indicates no cascade propgation.

property.name: entityAggergationCascade
property.documentation:
Indicates how a UML aggreation should be interpreted to determine cascadable operations that are propogated to the associated entity.
If underfined, aggregation is not interpreted as a cascade value.
If the property is defined, its valie is generated at each occurence of a UML aggregation ad the inverse side is not marked with a cascade annotation element which indicates no cascade propogation.

property.name: entityDefaultGeneratorType
property.documentation: Default entity identifier primary key generator type set to AUTO unless specified using @andromda.persistence.column.generatorType tagged value.

property.name: entityDefaultGeneratorInitialValue
property.documentation: Default generator initial value used when allocating id numbers from the generator.

property.name: entityDefaultGeneratorAllocationSize
property.documentation: Default generator amount to increment by when allocating id number from the generator.

property.name: entityInheritanceStrategy
property.documentation:
Defines the entity inheritance strategy used for the entity class hierarchy (unless overridden on an entity level by the
@andromda.persistence.inheritance
tagged value, can be the following possible values:
SINGLE_TABLE - table per hierarchy.
TABLE_PER_CLASS - table per class in hierarchy.
JOINED - Table per class.

property.name: entityDiscriminatorType
property.documentation:
The value of the discriminatorType element for the Inheritance annotation of the entity. Possible values are:
STRING
CHAR
INTEGER

property.name: entityDiscriminatorColumnName
property.documentation: The DiscriminatorColumn annotation defines the discriminator column for the SINGLE_TABLE and JOINED mapping inheritance strategies. The name element defines the name of the column to be used for the discriminator. It will default to TYPE if it is required and not specified..

property.name: entityGenericFinders
property.documentation:
Specifies whether to include the generic finder property. Generic finders in the entity bean include findByPrimaryKey and findAll. Permitted values are:
true
false

property.name: entityDefaultEnumLiteralColumnLength
property.documentation: The default column length specified for the storage of a string based enumeration literal.

property.name: serviceViewType
property.documentation:
The default view type accessability for a session bean.
Permitted values are:
local
remote
both

property.name: serviceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the service locator class.

property.name: persistenceContainerName
property.documentation:
The default persistence container engine name. Used when specifying specific annotations for different persistence containers. Possible values are:
jboss
weblogic

property.name: persistenceContextUnitName
property.documentation: Specifies the default persistence context unit name associated with the default Entity Manager.

property.name: specificCollectionInterfaces
property.documentation: A flag indicating whether or not specific collection interfaces will be used in association end mutators and accessors (i.e. java.util.Set, java.util.List, etc). If this is set to false, then the value of the defaultCollectionInterface property will used to provide the collection interface.

property.name: defaultCollectionInterface
property.documentation: The default collection interface, this is the interface used with association end accessors and mutators if the specificCollectionInterfaces flag is set to false.

property.name: associationCollectionType
property.documentation: Used to define the default mapping for EJB3 collections.

property.name: compositionDefinesEagerLoading
property.documentation: Allows you to turn on/off whether or not composite associations will define eager loading and aggregate associations define lazy loading.

property.name: securityRealm
property.documentation: Specifies the security domain to use for role based authorization. Use the security realm to match allowed roles. This is only applicable for session beans and MDBs.

property.name: queryUseNamedParameters
property.documentation: Whether or not named parameters (i.e. ':someParameter') or unnamed (i.e. '?') parameters should be used in the SQL queries embedded within the model. NOTE: Does not apply to queries written in OCL.

property.name: transactionType
property.documentation:
The default value to use for transaction types.
Permitted values are:
NOT_SUPPORTED
SUPPORTS
REQUIRED
REQUIRES_NEW
MANDATORY
NEVER
NOTE: Can be overridden on a per entity basis with the
@andromda.ejb.transaction.type
tagged value.

property.name: ejb3TypesPackage
property.documentation: The package to which extra types are generated (i.e. ServiceLocator).

property.name: parameterRequiredCheck
property.documentation: Whether or not parameters should be checked if they're required on services bean operation.

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: The encoding for xml documents

property.name: allowDefaultServiceException
property.documentation: Whether or not to generate a default exception for each service. This exception will handle unexpected exceptions occuring within the implemented operations.
